title: Montana Republicans report letters with mysterious powder
description: Montana Republican lawmakers are sharing that they received letters with white powder as federal agents investigate mysterious substances similarly mailed to GOP officials in two other states

title: WATCH:  Alligator charges at fisherman
description: A man visiting Hilton Head, South Carolina, captured the moment a fisherman was charged by an alligator. No one was injured and the alligator re-entered the pond shortly after.

title: WATCH:  ICYMI: Puppy outgrows hangout spot
description: Bruce a Golden Retriever puppy is still trying to fit into his favorite spot, under the TV, with everything from treats and toys.

title: Mix of bravado and access to guns contribute to mass shootings by teens
description: Recent high-profile mass shootings by young people underscore the deadly mix of teenage bravado, immaturity and growing access to high-powered guns that can kill faster and more efficiently than ever

title: Russia-Ukraine live updates: Putin briefed on 'armed rebellion' by Wagner Group
description: Putin has been briefed on an "attempted armed rebellion,"

title: Murder charges filed against 3 San Antonio police officers
description: Murder charges were filed Friday against three members of the San Antonio Police Department, the department said.

title: H. Lee Sarokin, judge who freed 'Hurricane' Carter, dies at 94
description: The federal judge who freed boxer Rubin “Hurricane” Carter and famously said tobacco companies engaged in a “vast” conspiracy to conceal the dangers of smoking has died in California

title: 11 passengers injured evacuating Cathay Pacific jet after aborted takeoff in Hong Kong
description: Eleven passengers have been injured during an evacuation of a Cathay Pacific jetliner that aborted its takeoff in Hong Kong due to a technical issue, according to the airline

title: At least 2 wounded in shooting at entertainment complex, officials say
description: Police are investigating the shooting at Scene75 Entertainment Center, officials said.

title: WATCH:  This nurse delivered her son's future wife 22 years ago
description: Kelsey Poll West and her then-fiance, Tyler West, were looking through baby pictures. Then, Tyler noticed someone who was holding her at the hospital.

title: US intelligence report on COVID-19 origins rejects some points raised by lab leak theory proponents
description: A new U.S. intelligence report rejects several points raised by those who argue COVID-19 leaked from a Chinese lab

title: Special counsel in Trump classified docs case asks judge to delay trial
description: Trump has denied all wrongdoing in the case.

title: New York City leans on public for help with e-bike crackdown after deadly fires
description: New York City officials said they would renew efforts to crack down on unsafe e-bike shops following a spate of deadly fires caused by lithium ion batteries

title: Body of 3rd climber killed in Washington state avalanche has been recovered
description: The body of the third and final climber killed in an avalanche in Washington state in February has been recovered

title: Police in California aren't immune from certain misconduct lawsuits, high court rules
description: The Supreme Court of California has ruled that police are not immune from civil lawsuits for misconduct that happens while they investigate crimes

title: Girlfriend of the dentist who killed his wife on safari sentenced to 17 years
description: A federal judge sentenced the girlfriend of the dentist convicted of murdering his wife on an African safari to 17 years in prison Friday

title: UN Security Council calls for halt to fighting in Sudan and protection of civilians
description: The U.N. Security Council is calling for a halt to fighting in Sudan and the protection of civilians

title: Tennessee, Kentucky battery plants for Ford electric vehicles on track for $9.2B federal loan
description: The U.S. Department of Energy says massive battery plants planned in Tennessee and Kentucky for Ford’s electric vehicles are on track to receive up to a $9.2 billion federal loan
